item.title: Accessible Information Guide to Direct Payment
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Accessible Information Guide to Direct Payment is for anyone seeking to understand or support understanding of SDS option 1.
What does it do? 

The Accessible Information Guide to Direct Payment explains how SDS option 1 works using short, easy read sentences and associated visuals.

How can you use it? 
The Accessible Information Guide to Direct Payment is designed for use as a supplement to your verbal explanation of SDS option 1. You can record any questions the person asks and the answers you give in the space at the end of the guide. You can then leave the guide with the person for reference.

item.title: Easy steps to directing your support
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Easy Steps Leaflet is for organisations, such as independent advice and information providers, who wish to offer an alternative SDS option 2 directly rather than through a care and support provider. In East Renfrewshire the Self-directed Support Forum are piloting an alternative option 2 for older people.
What does it do? 

The Easy Steps Leaflet explains how the alternative SDS option 2 works using short, easy read steps. It is designed to help people understand the role of the organisation who are delivering the alternative option 2.

How can you use it? 
The Easy Steps Leaflet is designed for use as a supplement to your verbal explanation of SDS option 2. You can then leave the leaflet with the person for reference.

item.title: Top Ten Tips: SDS for Substance Misuse Providers
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The SDS for Substance Misuse Providers is for service providers in the statutory, voluntary and private sectors preparing their organisations to offer self-directed support services.
What does it do? 

The SDS for Substance Misuse Providers sets out ten top tips for self-directed support implementation

How can you use it? 
The SDS for Substance Misuse Providers can be used by service providers to assess what they need to do to prepare for self-directed support. It can be used to draw up an action plan for implementation. It can also be used to assess progress.
